title: What element has 106 protons and 159 neutrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: An element with Z = 106 is named Seaborgium (Sg), an American nuclear chemist who was responsible for the synthesis of all the actinide elements (primarily Z beyond 94 to 103) and proposed actinoid concept. He was awarded Nobel prize for his unique contributions. Sg with 159 neutrons will have mass number (A) = 265 and is highly unstable with half-life of the order of milliseconds. Incidentally it is the only element which was named after a living scientist though there was lot of controversy in naming it but finally accepted by IUPAC.
One of the isotopes of seaborgium element has 106 protons and 159 neutrons, which is Sg-265(Z=106). This Isotope exists in two isomeric forms. Those are Sg-265a and Sg-265b. :)
